column1: Lord Pearce in the case of Onnassi Vs. Vergottis (1968) 2 Lloyd’s Report 403

column2: “One thing is clear not so much as a rule of law but rather as a working rule
of common sense. A trial judge has, except on rare occasions, a very great
advantage over an appellate court; evidence of a witness  heard and seen
has a very great advantage over a transcript of that evidence; and a Court

interfere  unless 
it 
is  satisfied  both

judge  and  the  Court  of  Appeal  has  not  been  occasioned  by  any
